page.title: 03MOTTISFONT
page.content: The village is a quiet small rural settlement centred around the Abbey, off the main road, about half a mile from Dunbridge Station. It is very attractive to visitors, set in the Test Valley, with open countryside and woods around it. Population 405. People work locally in agriculture, keepering, and tourism, and commute to Romsey and Southampton. Housing _ mostly old cottages and estate_workers houses. A few privately_owned houses, but mostly owned by Mottisfont Estate (N.T.) Recreation _ cricket, football, social _club, over_sixties. School ( closed 1981 ) now to be used as village_hall. Trades _ small car repair business, forestry, farming, cafe and bed and breakfast accommodation.
